description: Conjecturally, number of minimum points of '3x+(2n+1)' problem.
example: In '3x+1' problem (n->n/2 if even, n->3n+1 if odd) every n (conjecturally) reaches 1.In '3x+3' problem, every n (conjecturally) reaches 3.In '3x+5' problem, every n (conjecturally) reaches 1,5,19,23,187 or 347. (6 values)In '3x+7' problem, every n (conjecturally) reaches 5 or 7. (2 values)
author: _Christian G. Bower_, Feb 15 1999
